Gravity is a type of attraction between objects with mass (things that take up space and have weight). The more massive the objects, the stronger their gravitational pull. ðŸ¤¯

Imagine you're standing on Earth, holding a ball. If you let go, what happens? The ball falls to the ground, right? That's because the Earth's mass is pulling on the ball with an invisible force called gravity.

Gravity is also what keeps us attached to our planet, which is why we don't float off into space! ðŸŒŠ

But here's the cool thing about gravity: it's not just limited to giant planets and stars. It's a universal force that affects everything with mass, from tiny atoms to massive galaxies!
